content: on method cast on 60 70 80 90 100 110 sts join for working in the round placing a marker to indicate the start of the round be careful not to twist your stitches on the first round 60 70 80 90 100 110 the twisted german cast on is very stretchy it avoids having a mark on your forehead after wearing the hat you can find a tutorial here https //www youtube com/watch v=owhrfvu5im0 however if you are not comfortable with it you can use any other cast on you like ribbing with smaller needles r1 * p1tbl k1* all around repeat this row until you reach about 8 9 10 11 11 11 cm / 3 1 3 5 3 9 4 3 4 3 4 3 inches from cast-on knitting through back loop make the ribs more regular but if you are not comfortable with it you can use a classic *p1 k1* ribbing body switch to larger needles set-up row *k4 p1* - repeat to the end of the row r1 *k4 p1* - repeat to the end of the row r2 *c4b p1* - repeat to the end of the row repeat r1 and r2 until you reach about 13 5 16 19 21 22 5 23 cm / 5 3 6 3 7 4 8 2 8 9 9 1 inches from cast-on ending with a r2 crown shaping you can place a marker every 10 row to help you decrease r1 *k4 p1 k2 k2tog p1* - repeat to the end of the row r2 *c4b p1 c3b p1* - repeat to the end of the row 3 r3 *k2 k2tog p1 k3 p1* - repeat to the end of the row r4 *c3b p1 c3b p1* - repeat to the end of the row r5 *k3 p1 k1 k2tog p1* - repeat to the end of the row r6 *c3b p1 c2b p1 * - repeat to the end of the row r7 *k1 k2tog p1 k2tog p1* - repeat to the end of the row r8 *k2tog p1 k1 p1* - repeat to the end of the row r9 k2tog to the end of the row r10 k2tog to the end of the row sizes adult adult large adult extra large only - r11 k2tog to the end of the row cut yarn leaving at least 15cm 6 inches pull yarn through remaining stitches to close the hat weave in ends on the inside add a pompom if desired you re done congrats 4
